Options:
(A) red
(B) orange
(C) yellow
(D) green
(E) blue
(F) brown
(G) magenta
(H) fuchsia
(I) mauve
(J) teal
(K) turquoise
(L) burgundy
(M) silver
(N) gold
(O) black
(P) grey
(Q) purple
(R) pink
model_answer:
LECTURE: An object is a type of material. Wood, glass, metal, and plastic are common types of material.
A color is a type of pigment. Yellow, blue, and red are common types of pigment.
SOLUTION: The notebook is yellow. The paperclip is blue. The notebook is to the left of the paperclip.

question:
On the table, there are two magenta paperclips, one gold booklet, three blue booklets, and three green booklets. If I remove all the paperclips from the table, how many magenta objects remain on it?
Options:
(A) zero
(B) one
(C) two
(D) three
(E) four
(F) five
(G) six
(H) seven
(I) eight
(J) nine
(K) ten
(L) eleven
(M) twelve
(N) thirteen
(O) fourteen
(P) fifteen
(Q) sixteen
model_answer:
LECTURE: An object is a group of things that are all touching.
A magician was performing a trick. For the trick, the magician had to have many objects in view, but the audience could see only one at a time. To do this, the magician used a small mirror to reflect the light of one object onto another object that was not in view.
The magician had one ball in view, and it was reflecting light onto three other balls.
There are three blue booklets and three green booklets on the table. Each booklet is touching its neighbors
